convlab.modules.e2e.multiwoz.Mem2Seq.utils.measures module¶

convlab.modules.e2e.multiwoz.Mem2Seq.utils.measures.moses_multi_bleu(hypotheses, references, lowercase=False)[source]¶

Calculate the bleu score for hypotheses and references using the MOSES ulti-bleu.perl script. Args: hypotheses: A numpy array of strings where each string is a single example. references: A numpy array of strings where each string is a single example. lowercase: If true, pass the “-lc” flag to the multi-bleu script Returns: The BLEU score as a float32 value.

convlab.modules.e2e.multiwoz.Mem2Seq.utils.measures.wer(r, h)[source]¶

This is a function that calculate the word error rate in ASR. You can use it like this: wer(“what is it”.split(), “what is”.split())
